title: List of Alpha Kappa Alpha sisters
data: first to lead the Publisher 's Association
President of the National Bar Association
first African-American to own and operate a radio station in the city of Detroit ; president and chairperson of Bell Broadcasting Corporation
Vice President of Employment and Diversity , Wal-Mart Stores , Inc
founder of the Smith-Robertson Museum and Cultural Center
founder of DuSable Museum of African American History in Chicago , Illinois
first African book publisher in the United Kingdom ; writer and broadcaster ; inducted into the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire ( OBE ) by Queen Elizabeth II
chaired the NAACP 's national board of directors in 1975
global marketing director , personal care division , Avon
first African-American woman to form a commercial bank in the US

president of the National Association of Black Journalists ; Managing Editor and primary anchor at WTKR NewsChannel 3 in Norfolk , Virginia ; youngest woman and first African-American to become news director at a commercial television station in the Southwest ( KMSB-TV in Tucson , Arizona )
Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer for National Urban League
Founder of Westside Preparatory School in Chicago

president of Hitco Music Publishing ; first and only African-American woman to run a major publishing company , Midnight Songs ; former head of A & R at Universal Records ; Senior Vice President/Special Assistant to the Chairman ( Doug Morris ) of the Universal Music Group ; advisor , Afropunk Festival
only African-American to be nominated for an Academy Award for writing ; CEO of de Passe Entertainment
Senior Vice President of Global Communications , Verizon
first African-American woman to be part-owner of a major National Basketball Association team , the Chicago Bulls
businesswoman , recipient of the William F. Nabors Marketer of the Year Award
general manager , founder of Kimani Press
intro: This list of Alpha Kappa Alpha sorors (commonly referred to as AKAs) includes initiated and honorary members of Alpha Kappa Alpha (ΑΚΑ), the first inter-collegiate Greek-letter sorority established for Black college women. Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority was founded on January 15, 1908, at Howard University in Washington, D.C., by nine women who were known as The Original Group of 1908, and seven sophomores, who were accepted as honor initiates and are known as The Sophomores of 1910. Alpha Kappa Alpha has a membership of more than 200,000 women in over 950 chapters in the United States and several other countries. Membership is extended to female college undergraduate and graduate students. The sorority also bestows honorary membership as its highest honor.
